thread.title: Sonoma County’s roots are showing at Gravenstein Fair
thread.title_full: Sonoma County’s roots are showing at Gravenstein Fair - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Christine Delsol
title: Sonoma County’s roots are showing at Gravenstein Fair
text:
Photo: Michelle Feileacan 8335154|article-6402581|7 8335154|article-6402581|1 email_share_embed|photo-8335154|article-6402581|1 8335154|article-6402581|2 8335154|article-6402581|3 8335154|article-6402581|4 8335154|article-6402581|5 google_share_embed|photo-8335154|article-6402581|6 Sonoma County goes to its agricultural roots with the Gravenstein Apple Fair, where chefs apply their talents to the heirloom fruit and old-time contests, activities and demonstrations keep visitors busy all weekend. Sonoma County goes to its agricultural roots with the Gravenstein...
Sebastopol’s Gravenstein Apple Fair puts the famous heirloom fruit at the heart of its old-time festivities in Ragle Ranch Park, starting with the chef’s tent and extending to darts games, a pie-eating contest and juggling. An Artisan Cheese Lounge offers seated pairings of cider, beer or wine with local cheese, and a Do-It-Yourself Arena tutors participants in the arts of making mozzarella, felting wool and herbal medicines, among other skills. Kids’ activities range from a hay maze to a youth circus, and live music will issue from two stages throughout each day. Sonoma County goes to its agricultural roots with the Gravenstein Apple Fair, where chefs apply their talents to the heirloom fruit and old-time contests, activities and demonstrations keep visitors busy all weekend. Sebastopol’s Gravenstein Apple Fair puts the famous heirloom fruit at the heart of its old-time festivities in Ragle Ranch Park, starting with the chef’s tent and extending to darts games, a pie-eating contest and juggling. An Artisan Cheese Lounge offers seated pairings of cider, beer or wine with local cheese, and a Do-It-Yourself Arena tutors participants in the arts of making mozzarella, felting wool and herbal medicines, among other skills. Kids’ activities range from a hay maze to a youth circus, and live music will issue from two stages throughout each day.
